title: "Day2: Examining, Modifying and Grouping Datasets"
author: "Hardik Monga"

## Intro

Making a new post.

## Installing Libraries



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```


## Look at the mpg dataset



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpg %>%
  head(10)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 4 audi         a4           2    2008     4 auto… f        21    30 p     comp…
```

## Ways to examine the mpg dataset

#### Glimpse



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glimpse(mpg)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 234
Columns: 11
$ manufacturer <chr> "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "…
$ model        <chr> "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4 quattro", "…
$ displ        <dbl> 1.8, 1.8, 2.0, 2.0, 2.8, 2.8, 3.1, 1.8, 1.8, 2.0, 2.0, 2.…
$ year         <int> 1999, 1999, 2008, 2008, 1999, 1999, 2008, 1999, 1999, 200…
$ cyl          <int> 4, 4, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 8, 8, …
$ trans        <chr> "auto(l5)", "manual(m5)", "manual(m6)", "auto(av)", "auto…
$ drv          <chr> "f", "f", "f", "f", "f", "f", "f", "4", "4", "4", "4", "4…
$ cty          <int> 18, 21, 20, 21, 16, 18, 18, 18, 16, 20, 19, 15, 17, 17, 1…
$ hwy          <int> 29, 29, 31, 30, 26, 26, 27, 26, 25, 28, 27, 25, 25, 25, 2…
$ fl           <chr> "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p", "p…
$ class        <chr> "compact", "compact", "compact", "compact", "compact", "c…
```


:::
:::

## Mutating mpg's variables to factors and saving them as mpg_modified



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpg_modified <- mpg %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    cyl = as_factor(cyl),
    fl = as_factor(fl),
    drv = as_factor(drv),
    class = as_factor(class),
    trans = as_factor(trans)
  )
glimpse(mpg_modified)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 234
Columns: 11
$ manufacturer <chr> "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "audi", "…
$ model        <chr> "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4", "a4 quattro", "…
$ displ        <dbl> 1.8, 1.8, 2.0, 2.0, 2.8, 2.8, 3.1, 1.8, 1.8, 2.0, 2.0, 2.…
$ year         <int> 1999, 1999, 2008, 2008, 1999, 1999, 2008, 1999, 1999, 200…
$ cyl          <fct> 4, 4, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4, 4, 4, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 8, 8, …
$ trans        <fct> auto(l5), manual(m5), manual(m6), auto(av), auto(l5), man…
$ drv          <fct> f, f, f, f, f, f, f, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, r, …
$ cty          <int> 18, 21, 20, 21, 16, 18, 18, 18, 16, 20, 19, 15, 17, 17, 1…
$ hwy          <int> 29, 29, 31, 30, 26, 26, 27, 26, 25, 28, 27, 25, 25, 25, 2…
$ fl           <fct> p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, p, r, …
$ class        <fct> compact, compact, compact, compact, compact, compact, com…
```


:::
:::



## Examining and Modifying babynames dataset

#### Import babynames dataset



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(babynames)
```
:::



#### babynames dataset



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

 3  1880 F     Emma       2003 0.0205
```

#### Mutate babynames



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
babynames_modified <- babynames %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    year = as_factor(year),
    sex = as_factor(sex),
    name = as_factor(name),
    n = as_factor(n),
    prop = as_factor(prop)
  )
glimpse(babynames_modified)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Rows: 1,924,665
Columns: 5
$ year <fct> 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880, 1880,…
$ sex  <fct> F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F, F,…
$ name <fct> Mary, Anna, Emma, Elizabeth, Minnie, Margaret, Ida, Alice, Bertha…
$ n    <fct> 7065, 2604, 2003, 1939, 1746, 1578, 1472, 1414, 1320, 1288, 1258,…
$ prop <fct> 0.07238359, 0.02667896, 0.02052149, 0.01986579, 0.01788843, 0.016…
```


:::
:::

## Group by in mpg



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpg_modified %>% filter(manufacturer == "audi") %>% 
  group_by(manufacturer, class, year) %>%
  summarize(average_cty = mean(cty), average_hwy=mean(hwy) )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'manufacturer', 'class'. You can override
using the `.groups` argument.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 4 × 5
# Groups:   manufacturer, class [2]
  manufacturer class    year average_cty average_hwy
  <chr>        <fct>   <int>       <dbl>       <dbl>
1 audi         compact  1999        17.4        26.4
2 audi         compact  2008        18.6        27.6
3 audi         midsize  1999        15          24  
4 audi         midsize  2008        16.5        24  
```


:::
:::
